title: Acid and base strength from equations

content.description: <math alttext="H C N, aqueous, plus H 2 O, liquid, is in equilibrium with H 3 O with a positive 1 charge, aqueous, plus C N with a negative 1 charge, aqueous, where K sub a equals 6.2 times 10, raised to the negative 10 power" overflow="scroll"> <mi>HCN</mi> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>l</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> <mo>⇄</mo> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <msup> <mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi> <mo>+</mo> </msup> <mpadded> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> </mpadded> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mpadded> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mi>CN</mi> <mo>-</mo> </msup> <mpadded> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>a</mi> <mi>q</mi> </mpadded> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <mspace width="0.4em"> </mspace> <msub> <mi>K</mi> <mi>a</mi> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>6.2</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mn>10</mn> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mpadded> </math>
content.question: <math alttext="H 2 O, liquid, plus H 2 O, liquid, is in equilibrium with H 3 O with a positive 1 charge, aqueous, plus O H with a negative 1 charge, aqueous, where K sub w equals 1.0 times 10, raised to the negative 14 power" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>l</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>l</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>+</mo></msup><mpadded><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mpadded><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>OH</mi><mo>-</mo></msup><mpadded><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>w</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>14</mn></mrow></msup></mpadded></math> Based on the chemical equations given, which of the following statements is correct?

choices.label: <math alttext="H C N" overflow="scroll"><mi>HCN</mi></math> is a weaker acid than <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>.
<math alttext="C N with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>CN</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></math> is a stronger acid than <math alttext="H C N" overflow="scroll"><mi>HCN</mi></math>.

<math alttext="C N with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>CN</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></math> is a stronger base than <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>.

<math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math> is a weaker base than <math alttext="H C N" overflow="scroll"><mi>HCN</mi></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="C N with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>CN</mi><mo>-</mo></msup></math> is a stronger base than <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>.

skill.text: 1.B: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate both particulate-level and macroscopic- level properties.
